review: Our well attired group of six walked into this half empty T.G.I. Friday's on a slow Monday night during the Christmas holiday.  Two patrons in dirty blue jeans sat in the bar area, slumped forward over their drinks.  The bartender scowled at us from across the room. At the bar, beer foam coagulated and dripped out of spill mats and pooled on the floor.  At the hostess station, the lone waitress cast an irritated glance at us.  While walking away from us, she shouted that our table would be ready in a few minutes. The ladies of our group used the opportunity to visit the restroom.  Upon their return, the gentlemen did the same.  Both the ladies and gentlemen had the same experiences in their respective restrooms: appalling filth.  My wife was savagely attacked by one of the toilet paper holders.  Everyone's shoe soles had to be soaked in a weak bleach solution upon returning home that night because of the quarter inch deep sewage coating the bathroom floors. At this point, a total of five minutes had elapsed.  We waited another two minutes, with no updates or response from the wait staff. Sensing the indifference of the waitresses, our group made the collective decision through mental telepathy to high tail across the various curbs and the entry drives from Van Dyke, and finally across the sopping wet grass to the Papa Vino's Italian restaurant next store, a sort of Olive Garden knock off.  Upon entering Papa Vino's, a smiling gentleman with a charming Foreign accent greeted us at once.  We had drinks and bread within a few minutes at our table, and everyone were pleased. Perhaps the boss at the T.G.I. Friday's was in Cancun the week we visited and the wait staff were enjoying a vacation of their own by ignoring customers.  We'll probably never know, because there is no good reason to come to this  T.G.I. Friday's except if the wait at Buddy's down the road is really really long.

It is Sunday afternoon, me and momma already to see "Sparkle" at MJR Theaters! I've been went along time along at T.G.I. Friday's, I ordered a seasoned salad it will good on my diet. You going out at T.G.I. Friday's, bring to your friends and family!

Haven't been to a Fridays in quite a while so we decided to stop in around 7 ish on a Friday night.  Parking lot was packed so we were concerned that there would be a long wait but there wasn't and we were seated right away.  Hostess was very nice and offered us a smaller two person booth or a larger one--very nice to be given the choice since my dining partner is a larger person.  Typical chain restaurant and ambiance, not as loud as some of the other Friday's I've been to in the area.  Menu looked decent, lots of steak specials and another two person meal deal that seems to be the fad in the chain restaurants lately.  Server was excellent--friendly and very attentive.  The food was a bit of a let down though.  We ordered nachos and they came in what looked like half tortilla size portions.  Like 3 tortillas halved and then nacho fixings (two little scoops of sour cream/guacamole).  Why not just quarter the chips or just pile some chips on the platter?  Tasted good but looked weird.  My burger was just okay, nothing really special.  Not much bleu cheese and didn't look anything like the picture.  For almost  $10 I got a small burger and an even smaller portion of sweet potato fries--maybe 12 on the plate.  I could have gone to Five Guys and got a better burger for the money.  Oh well, it wasn't horrible since my dining partner really enjoyed his steak.  Not sure if this place is worth the money on regular entrees, might come back for the two for deals though.

*sigh* and yet again i have to give another place a negative review. i literally have $45 worth of gift certificates from this place because i had such a terrible experience here. i am still debating whether or not i even want to give this place a second chance. i went to this location with my family, it was a slow tuesday evening. our waiter seemed to be friendly at first, but he stopped coming to our table after he took our food orders. we received absolutely no refills, we didn't receive a drink that we ordered, and we also did not receive an appetizer we ordered. we waited over 25 minutes for our food and when it finally arrived it was cold! such a disappointing experience, the bus boy had to come to our table because our waiter completely abandoned us. we of course wanted to speak to the manager and when she came to our table, she only gave us 20% off, not enough considering our food was ice cold, and we never even got any refills. i do not understand how these kinds of places are operating with the kinds of managers that they have running them!  long story short our bus boy ended up receiving the tip because well, the waiter was no where to be found.

Went here today for the first time, it was after a movie at MJR Marketplace.  Pros: it was Monday night and we paid about $8 for 4 appetizers, which was a great deal. How, you ask? Monday night is half-off appetizer night, we got the mozzarella sticks, potstickers, and beef skewers, all of which were yummy, plus the chips and salsa. I'm a Stripes member so the chips were free, and I also had a free app coupon from my last time (from filling out the survey on the receipt). Another pro: the hostess was very nice, and seated us promptly. Cons: The waitress was fast but highly inattentive. Had to wait a while for a water refill. She wasn't that friendly too ... not MEAN or anything per say but just not that friendly. I went to use the bathroom and there was toilet paper and paper towels everywhere. We had a group of children with their parents near us and they were super, super loud (obviously not the restaurant's fault, but still ...) and the parents just let them sit there and scream all night.  I'd go back here again but ONLY if I was in the area ... Van Dyke seems to have a lot of other chains too though, so there are more choices. I prefer the Novi or Troy location to this one by far.

The only good thing about TGi Friday's is Happy Hour. TGI's is like Applebee's: the food is average at best and the "chain restaurant theme novelty" ended years ago. You pay for food that is below the level of other non-chain places, and I don't know the appeal of why people still come here unless they are getting sloshed at the bar. The waiters and waitresses are alright, but they don't wow you with anything. If the food was better and not so pricey for its mediocrity, then I would go more often. Otherwise, I'll stick to the other eateries that offer better dishes and originality.

Great place for happy hour. The bartenders are very attentive & friendly. The food is very good & some dishes are on special for happy hour. The chicken, shrimp & cheese skillet is to die for. My friends & I come every week for the good food & great atmosphere.

The ladies room was so dirty. Puked all over the floor&  one of the toilet there was shit all round it. Had to wait for ever for our drink orders. Came in at 8:30 and it's 9:21 now and still haven't even got our appetizer. They suck! If I can give them a no star I would.

Came here one night, pretty late, not really expecting anything but a few good drinks. Once we walked in and smelled the food, we ended up ordering.  I got the ribeye, tomato mozz salad and mashed potatoes and it was absolutely delicious. Their margaritas were excellent and the bartenders were busy but very friendly and one could do some flair which was cool.

Came here around 9pm at night. Ryan was my server and he was fantastic!! He was not oy friendly, but proper and expierenced on the menu. He offered and gave suggestions. We were checked on often, as well. Overall, my night was fabulous. Management was also extremely generous and understanding. I will be back.

Ordered endless mozzarella cheese sticks the came to the table semi hot most of the times , Turkey club with sweet potato fries had barely any mayo on the sandwich, Sizzling Chicken (with two mushrooms) which was a small chicken Brest with some spinach and some cooked squash, tropical raspberry tea (some were way too sweet) , ruby red bull slush (which was crushed ice with red bull pretty much.

I give it two stars because to food is good, but the waitstaff is horrible. The first time we went the staff was completely unprofessional. It's a place of business, I should no have to sit and listen to the employees chat about their personal lives. On top of that the foul language they used amongst themselves was offensive to my mother in law.  The second time we went we couldn't even get a table even though the place was half empty because they were short staffed....seems like bad management to me. From now on I'll find another TGIFridays to eat at.

The service here is terrible. Don't bother coming here for lunch because it'll take them one hour to get your burger. Clearly the restaurant isn't even busy but even appetizers took 40 minutes to get out. The waiter didn't even come by our table to check or refill drinks. Avoid this place!

Went into this location on a Thursday afternoon after work with my 2 year old son. Keep in mind, I'm also a waitress/bartender so I understand the ins and outs of the service industry. Upon entering the establishment, we were greeted by a kind and smiling hostess who sat us in the back corner near the kitchen, grabbed my son a high chair, and told us our server would be right with us. I kept him busy with the crayons and kiddie menu that were provided for as long as I could, but anybody with young children understands that this only lasts for so long. 5 minutes goes by... 7... 10.. and after 12 minutes of sitting with my son, who's noisy enough as it is so it's not like the server wouldn't have noticed us, without being approached by any staff member, we went to the hostess stand to let them know what was going on. She stood there and stared at me.... At that point, we were both starving so I said we were just going to get a carry out instead. She rudely 'apologized' and pointed us over to the bar. No manager came over to speak with us. We ordered a carryout with the bartender who seemed less then pleased to help us and while waiting were approached by another member of the waitstaff who tried to "explain" what had happened and why we were left to sit there. Thanks but no thanks. Because I do the same exact job as you do, I find these excuses absurd as I would never allow a guest to have such a horrid experience without some attempt at making it right. We waited 25+ minutes for a kids Mac and cheese and the sizzling chicken and shrimp (which were cold/way over cooked/bland/disgusting/etc..) All in all this was a horrible experience and we will not be back. There is absolutely no good reason for why things turned out the way they did that day. Bye bye T.G.I

Was greeted by a nice smiling hostess who seated us immediately. We sat for 15 minutes with no waitress in sight. She then breezed by and said she would be right back. Ten more mixtures without even a drink and she stared at us as we got up and left. Terrible service here
Not bad but the seats we were in were cracked and needed to be fixed. Food was hot and good. Server was nice and she was efficient.

First time in this branch, absolutely horrible service, very slow and not friendly bartender. Ordered a jack Daniels burger came with saggy fries and old bread it was literally from 10 days ago I am very upset I just returned the food and paid my beer and ready to leave. I wish I could give them zero stars

Horrible service. Every time me and my family of 5 come in even on a weekday there's a 30-45 minute wait while there's a whole section empty then the staff is very unprofessional and careless. Customers wait while they're playing and eating and drinking. Cook came from the back and was dirty. Very disturbing to see his uniform filthy and he's preparing food for customers. This place needs new training and new management.

I should have referenced the other reviews before coming in last night. Service was very slow and our burger came with stale fries. I came for the drink specials, but even that was a disappointment. They had decent options for kids and our server was friendly. Overall, it's not a very good deal and I won't be back.
Only 1/3 of the restaurant was being used because the kitchen was backed up and they couldn't seat us. 20 minute wait time. Will not be returning.

I would rate this zero stars if I could. I have been here once and I will never ever ever go back. First off, the hostess had an attitude, it was really slow, and she took 15 minutes to seat us. Once we sat down, we waited ten minutes for our drink order..... We out in an order for an appetizer and that actually made it to the table BEFORE our drinks. The food sucked, the staff was rude, and there was not a a manger to be seen anywhere. When I tried to contact someone about the experience, no one reached out to me. Will never be back, at any location.

This would be a zero if that rating was available. We went here last night and the guy that walked us to the table had his pants sagging down to his knees and didn't say a word to us - no "a waitress will be with you in a moment" or even a simple hello. Then we waited 15 min for the waitress to stop by our table - she walked by and said "I'll be back in a min to take your drink order" and then she walked around the dish station behind our booth and start complaining to one of her coworkers. She walked by again without stopping by our table, stopped by one of her other tables, and then went back to the bar area. No sense of urgency at all. We left after waiting over 15 min for a drink order when the place wasn't even overly busy. I'll never go back to this location.

Just had lunch Today with my Wife and there was nobody in the place and now I know why. It took 45 mins to get a soup and salad, my salad had 7 butt ends from the lettuce head. The waitress was sitting down in the corner talking with the rest of the workers when they should have been making sure our visit was a pleasant one. I will not be back to this location anytime soon.

Pick another spot.  I nearly gave just one star, but I like to differentiate the bad from the truly horrible. We arrived shortly after 2 pm, so the restaurant was not busy. The hostess was far from welcoming, though nothing in particular was unpleasant. The floors were grossly sticky; shoes did not leave the ground easily and we could hear everyone walk.  Our waiter was pleasant, albeit sluggish at best. When our table of four ordered drinks, I ordered a tea and a water. My tea came out with the others, but we had to hail him ten minutes later so I could get my water. He responded with a clearly annoyed, "I'm getting it. Gimme a second." That interaction was the tone for our entire meal.  Two drinks on our table were refreshed during the hour and a half we were there when it would have been appropriate for six to ten refreshes tablewide. He was borderline ignoring us despite that we were his only table for at least half an hour. Our orders consisted of salads, a sandwich, and a sizzler. Forty minutes later, the sizzler came out; it arrived with a promise of the others on the way out. When asked 10 minutes later, the waiter said the other dishes were on the way out.  Another 10 minutes passed before the other dishes arrived. Also, two of the orders were wrong: a salad came without chicken and an extra side nobody would eat arrived with the entree. (Side note: the mashed potatoes are bland at best - but they were well plated. Nobody was impressed with any of the food, meaning everything was between mediocre and decent [2-3.5 on a 5-point scale].) There is nothing to recomend this place.  In short, go elsewhere!  - Heather
The host was really nice and sweet but after she sat us that was the last we saw help. We waited 20 minutes for a server before we just left.

This is not my favorite Friday's but here we are. Ordered the chicken n shrimp my wife allergic to onions and waiter comes back to inform us that the peppers and onions are a "medley" and it's a problem for them to take them out. But every other Friday's we go to clearly has no issues taking them out without explaining that they are part of a "medley"... I usually don't complain on Yelp, but I mean seriously.... Isn't that why they called cooks, cook the food man if she don't want onions either take them out or just chop up some peppers without the onions simple Process... Updated 1/28/17 : Came here again, and waited 20 minutes for a drink. After waiting 20 minutes for water and a server.... yay me

Tried this location again and now I rem why I never come here. Went for lunch on Memorial Day so it wasn't crowded. When the waitress took our drink order I asked for a coke which she replied, diet ?? I was like uh no just reg. Guess she thought I needed diet. Then I said Sprite for my daughter and the server says how about an orange Fanta? I'm like no I said Sprite or 7up whichever clear soda. I thought that was just weird. Then she brings our cokes and they were infact diet so she says they aren't and comes back with new cokes which tasted fine so yes she gave us diet. Then I ordered chicken strips for my son and a side salad for my daughter and mentioned to the server they  can share the chicken so when she brought it out he had no fries and a salad in place of the fries. I didn't want the salad in place of the fries that was just in addition. I had the strawberry fields salad which is supposed to have goat cheese and there was like 2 crumbles on the whole salad. The floors were sticky, they were out of crayons and the server was slow and I had to ask for ranch twice. I will never come back to this location. There was hardly anyone there and she still took forever

Just placed a carry out order for the Tuscan spinach dip from Brandy - girl didn't even say goodbye, give me a total, time frame, anything-just hung up on me.  At first I thought the call dropped so I called back.  She answered and I told her that it was me again and she just said oh is there something you wanted to add?  I said no...I thought the call might've dropped and she said oh no I got the order and she then hung up on me again.   Let's see what the manager has to say.

This place is not for adults of a particular age which is why I took my son for his 21st birthday. He enjoyed his drink, the servers were great but the food left nothing to be desired. It was pretty gross & I felt sick for about a day.

Ask for Ryan he's great, also if you're a party above 8 I recommend somewhere else! Patrick is a great server as well, he's in the bar side. Ribs are only 10$ for the time being and it's a pretty great deal, full slab too! Jd glaze always wins over the taste buds keep it up!

Our family celebrated a birthday at TGI Fridays on Sunday, July 24, 2016. Our experience was horrible and very disappointing. Instead of taking our orders after the introduction of our Caucasian/white servers, "Jessie" and "Casey," they gave us dirty looks and unfriendly stares. They, then, walked away from us and returned with the store manager, "Tracey," and a Manager-In-Training, "Nate." Tracey informed us that TGI Fridays doesn't normally accommodate parties/groups over eight (8) persons, although we previously informed the host there were over 15 persons in our party before we were seated. (Our AFRICAN AMERICAN family group at the time consisted of 16-two tables of 8. We further informed them that other family members were in the parking lot and more family members were coming). We knew this wasn't true because we had celebrated a birthday with a large group over 8 at that same Fridays location a couple of years prior. My family members spoke with Tracey for approximately 30 minutes trying to understand the problem/issue. Finally, although Tracey ultimately decided to "accommodate" us, the service was horrible: Our orders were not immediately taken; the servers, Jessie and Casey, were very sarcastic and rude, although they tried to feign good service at the end to get tips; many of our family members had to wait approximately an hour to be served appetizers, and then later, entrees; we were met with nasty attitudes when we made requests/asked for the "Birthday Song;" and were made to feel very disregarded and unwelcome. The restaurant was not crowded at all and many of the tables were empty. (We have photos). Our experience was very negative, and it's unfair that our family group-28 people-spent hundreds of dollars on that occasion, but was treated/serviced so poorly because of our race. Despite how unprofessionally we were treated, we remained polite and respectful to the manager, Tracey, and the servers, Jessie and Casey. We did not leave Fridays until after 8 p.m. because of the delayed/late service.  It was a rather unfortunate experience, and it's only fitting that such conduct be addressed. I'm sure TGI Fridays will conclude that the experience was A LOT worse than what I'm able to convey in limited characters."

Typical TGI Fridays menu, but service is often slow.  The restaurant seems lifeless.  Often very few customers on Sundays when we stop in.  Servers seem to be used to a slow pace and lack enthusiasm.  The atmosphere at the Hall Road and Schoenherr location is completely different....and a better choice.
Horrible service. Your order is always wrong once it gets to you and the waitresses seem to forget about everything you asked for.

Didn't even make it past the hostess. Five minutes standing there wondering what was going on, hostess finally showed, asked if we wanted a booth or a table, said "hold on a second" with an attitude and proceeded to walk off slowly and disappear for five minutes until we decided to walk out. Ridiculous. Went to Leo's Coney Island across the street and had a much better experience. Skip this location if you can.

I usually love Tgif but I will tell you the drinks were on point but the service in the bar was horrible .I had to call someone over to take my drink order, to take my food order and to bring us a bill. I called them for everything . Service was terrible.  Good drinks from the bar though.

I should've listened to the reviews of this place and not went here. I was thinking in my head maybe these people who reviewed this place were just unlucky. It was my first time going to this place. I went on a Sunday with a couple of my buddies. We ordered burgers and fries and mozzarella sticks at the appetizer. The mozzarella sticks on the menu said 5 dollars. So when we got our burgers, they tasted bland af. We had to force ourselves to eat the burger because it wasn't good. I couldn't even finish my burger because it tasted awful. And I didn't even want to take a to go box because it wasn't even worth taking home. I wouldn't even serve this food to homeless people. So when we got our bill I looked at the receipt and it said 7.99 for the mozzarella sticks. I was confused because I thought I told the waitress I wanted the 5 dollar mozzarella sticks that was pictured on the menu and the one that I was clearly pointing at when I ordered. The waitress said there was two options the full one is 7.99 and the half one is 5.00. I'm like wait she didn't even tell us there was two options. The waitress just assumed we wanted the full mozzarella sticks and basically overcharged us and made no apologizes afterwards. I had no problem paying for it but I just want to know what I'm paying for. Overall the food was HORRIBLE! and the waitress provided bad service. This is my first time going here and also my last time.

Wish that I read some of these reviews before tonight. Wish you could give a (-5) rating.   I was starving and I haven't been to TGI Fridays in years, sizzling chicken and shrimp really sounded good .... TERRIBLE. I have never experienced service that bad.  We walked in, the host mumbled something underneath his breath and started walking - we were not sure whether he said to follow him or what....... AWKWARD. Anyway, upon being seated - a girl approached us, asking if we were ready. We said we needed a few minutes, she didn't let us finish our sentence and she was already walking away. My drink was supposed to be a lemonade slush.... it was melted. We ordered a boneless wing appetizer and two dinner entrees. About half hour went by, she brought us our appetizer and said "your food will be up shortly" ; I said "can I please get some more water" ........ WE NEVER SAW HER AGAIN. Another 40 minutes went by. No staff was anywhere to be found. Another guest at the restaurant walked up her own check, then walked back to her seat, then walked up to get her change. We saw a waitress (not ours) and after saying "excuse me" 4x- she finally looked up at us - I asked "do you guys have a manager around" she said "what's the problem" .... I said "well we've been waiting for our food for like 1 1/2 now ... she yelled something into the back of the kitchen and we never saw her again. A manager never came. We waited about 10 more minutes and at that point got up and tried to find a manager, a waiter, anybody .... and realized everyone (manager included) was standing in the kitchen. They all looked up at us and literally laughed.  We left. We didn't pay for the wings or the shitty drinks. Cause ... kiss my ass. Not sure how the hell they are still open. Where is corporate?

The service here is bad.. not average not alright, just bad. I'm specifically talking about the bar service. One of the bartenders makes the worst long Island I have had in my life. No lie. my food was served and I was going to see how long it was going to take for the bartender to give me silverware to eat.. over 10 minutes. Then it's like they are doing you a favor by making another drink. Management needs to hire new bartenders and do it fast before the business fails.

If you are thinking about eating here, don't do it. THE SERVICE HERE SUCKS MONKEY BALLS!!!! The staff is slow and unenthusiastic. There was no music playing in the background, and some of the tv's weren't working right. No energy at all!! Just plain ol' boring. We were seated promptly but sat at the table for 20 mins or more, and no one acknowledged us. I had to stop a staff member walking by just so we could be waited on. The only thing good about my visit was my food. I'm only giving this place one star because the guy that waited on us was n

No greeter at door we just stood there. So waitress  forgot  order maybe  write it down.  I say please  have a person greet you. They lost me at the door really  but we were hungry. Melanie was a bright spot in our visit.

I have come here on multiple occasions only to leave with having had a terrible customer service experience or just walk out without dining in because of not even getting greeted for 15 minutes+! Today was so bad however that I felt it necessary to write this review. Walked in, hosts don't greet...so we decided to sit at the bar top. The place was not very busy at all. We sat and proceeded to not be greeted by either bartender for 10 minutes. Finally we overheard the bartender say to the other bartender "can you greet them at the end of the bar?" (Referring to me and my boyfriend as we were the only ones on that side) to which she audibly replied "the white ones? No" and she went to the kitchen, the other bartender then comes over, sets down beverage napkins says "are y'all even 21? I'll get you some waters" then walks away without even asking for our ids (which we are both 25 and work in the service industry, so we know this is absolutely unacceptable treatment of guests)I've been in the service industry 7 years myself and would never be okay with treating ANY customers this way. We immediately got up and left. Not only did you lose money from your ignorance and bad customer service, but we will unfortunately not be returning to this location again. Keep your personal beliefs aside and be a professional at your job. I've never been so disgusted. Terrible!

3 Times, we have given this place a chance, we really like TGI Fridays, but this LOCATION, and the SERVICE is the WORST...... ON ALL 3 VISITS. The staff could care less about you. Last night was the final straw, we had a party of 9, arrived around 520 pm, plenty of tables available, they were not BUSY... The greeter tells us, they can't accommodate us for at least an hour, because the kitchen is BACKED UP... Are you serious, I could not believe it, we went to Malones down the street, they immediately set a table up,were pleasant, and took care of us.  NOT SURE where Corporate is but this location has GONE DOWN HILL... It's a shame.

If I could I would give 0 stars to this place. So me and my husband came here to try their drink deals and $10 appetizers. We walked into the bar room and sat at the bar table. For 10 min we were ignored. As the two waitresses clearly saw us, gave us eye contact did not greet us. They had about 8 tables full and one other couple at the bar table. Finally one of them greeted us and gave us menus. We told her what alcoholic drinks we wanted and that's when it went all down hill. She literally took our drink orders and told the other chick and that was it.  For 30 min we did not receive our drinks. We were ignored. One of them was running around with an attitude and was very unprofessional talking ghetto and rude out loud. Even threw a pen at the other waitress because she was too lazy to walk to her and give it to her. The other waitress was too busy changing the tv station. And we literally sat there so upset. Like really. Is this how they run a business? Then more people came and everyone was either waiting for checks or refills or even to order. And here we sat completely ignored. We even made several eye contacts and nothing. We never received our drinks and our food orders were never taken. I hope this location shuts down or managements changes. Because it's places like this that is a waste of space. I plan on calling the manager and giving he or she an ear ful because our night was completely ruined by this idiotic unorganized unprofessional restaurant.

To preface this review, I don't go to chain very often and this particular TGI Fridays location is a prime example as to why. Visited for lunch on early Sunday afternoon and the place was dead. Our server oddly apologized for it being so busy and he'd be back as soon as he could... I thought he was joking at first, but it was apparent that he couldn't handle more than a table or two at a time. We waited about 30 minutes for our drinks and about another 30 minutes for our food. When asked about a separate drink order, he sent the manager over for some reason and he comped our drink, so at least there's that. Overall, we waited over an hour on a dead Sunday for microwaved food and old beer. Never again will I go to this, or any other Fridays location. This is why I'm through with big chains for the most part. The kids that run these joints just don't care and/or don't know how to do this job. I know it's not always easy work, but most people do it better than you.
The Jack Daniels burger is the best! The service was terrible, took 10 minutes to get water and the place was empty. The paper wrapper on my son's burger did not help

I HATE giving one star reviews but I have no choice. I've been here actually several times but tonight has inspired me to write this review. I came here with my BFF for dinner. It was not busy in here at all. The hostess tried to seat us at a small booth and I didn't want that because there were several large booths available and my friend is pregnant and I wanted her to feel comfy. We were sat at a large booth. Our server never came. In the restaurant industry, tables are supposed to be approached within 30 seconds for a greeting and/or taking drink orders. After about 5 minutes, I finally made eye contact with someone and it was our hostess and I asked her to grab our server. She gave me an attitude and was like, "Hold on, okay?" So we "held on" for about ten more minutes and decided to walk out. We were starving and we figured leaving here would mean we would have better service elsewhere. A family saw us leaving and we told them what happened because they had little kids and I didn't want them going hungry. They walked out with us.

We sat at the bar and it was less than half full. It took 15 minutes for the bartender to take our drink order and we had to go to the hostess stand to get menus. Because the bartender never asked if we wanted​ menus. After sitting for 40 minutes the bartender finally asked if we want to order. We left this is by far the worst experience I have ever had at a Fridays 0 's. When we complained to the manager before we left he just blew us off.

If I could give my advice I would just say close this place down. Bartender had one other table and we waited for drinks while he sat there and complained about a guest who ordered carry out but left because it was taking to long... surprise. Drinks took way to long to get to table and they were water and a diet coke. Apps and entree were ridiculously to long for only having three tables in restaurant. Completely unacceptable and this is not the first time we've had poor service at this location.
I made the mistake of giving this place a second chance only to walk in and be told. They are out of 2/3 of the menu. And that they apologize. I won't be coming back

We went there for my birthday dinner last night. We waited for 25 minutes just to be seated with most of the restaurant empty. We were seated, I felt, only because we reminded them that they had said that it was a 25 minute wait. So they finally seat us with scuzzy menus and we sat there another 25 minutes being completely ignored. The place was more empty than full. I don't understand what their malfunction is. So we got up and left after 50 minutes of being ignored and treated as though we were an inconvenience.

Came here on a Saturday night , they ran out of bacon and pot stickers..... plus long wait in between the endless apps waitress didn't even come into refill our drinks until we were ready to leave . .....if I could I would rate 0 stars ....

Tonight, I dined at the Fridays on Van Dyke rd. The service was appalling. From the moment we were seated in the bar room we didn't receive any service for 20min. The place was fairly empty. Our drinks took around 25min to come and we're made incorrectly by the bartender, even though they were directly off the summer at Friday's specials. The food took nearly an hour to arrive and was completely the wrong order. The waitress entered in the wrong items in the POS machine. When corrected it took nearly 35 more minutes. Our drinks were never attended to and it was impossible to get anything. Other patrons were walking out without service. The waitress would disappear in the kitchen for 30 minutes at a time and there was no one on the floor. I'm very disappointed with Friday's and would expect far better. This was a waste of $50.

Oh Friday's I used to love you now you make me sad. Your endless apps brought me back to you yesterday only to be let down yet again.  We planned on ordering endless apps and drinks and making a evening of it. When we walked in I thought great it's dead in here we'll be seated right away. Not so much. The host told us it would be at least 25 mins to get a table. My husband asked why since there are more empty tables than there were occupied ones. He told us those tables are closed.  My husband isn't a fan of waiting especially when you look around and see empty tables as far as the eye can see so we left and went to another place to eat/drink.  I'd understand sections being closed but people were sprinkled all over among the empty tables so it didn't seem like that was really the case. I don't know but from our prospective it seemed odd and unwelcoming.  I have a gift card to use so I'll probably try one more time to eat there but I'm pretty through with Friday's. The service is usually poor and this latest issue just sealed the deal.

Worst place ever. Waited for my steak for an hour and I asked for it medium and it was well done. I asked for sour cream they were out I asked for A1 steak sauce they brought me a empty bottle and the ketchup bottle was empty as well. Manager bought my dinner and the table behind me and in front of me were having issues to. Never again will I step foot in there again

What a joke.  Walked in at 1:30pm on a Wed.  Waited 5 min to be seated.  Finally sat myself.  Sat at a table out in the open for 30 min - not one person stopped by.  However, I did have two different waitresses walk by me multiple times.  Finally threw in the towel and packed up.  Hit the bathroom before I left ........smelled like a full port-o-potty after a week at the state fair - not exaggerating.  They actually have the name of the manager on the outside of this building......James Budnick.  James, you should be very embarrassed.
Decided to order lunch from them for the second time after a previous horrible experience.  Never again.

I usually am the one who calls and gives good comments to managers as they don't hear the good stuff enough. However this is twice now I've wrote a bad review in the matter of two weeks. This was horrible. Two hours and still we don't all have food. The food that came was cold. Manager was filling in from another store and was awesome but it was still unacceptable. Too bad we were there for a birthday celebration as we never got the desert we ordered either. Bad, bad, BAD!!!

We came in the hostess asked us how many guest we said 5 . She said 10 to 15 min wait. Then she came and told us she thought we had a party of 3 and 2 so then she proceeded to tell us it would be another 15 mins 45 mins later we speak to the manger he seats us  so u would think everything would be great .... NOT  we were told they were out of lemons, steak, bbq chicken strips, and nachos. Mind you this is Saturday at 4pm. So we order drinks 30 mins later the waitress ask us to reorder our drinks with our meals so that she can keep track.  After drink ordering she comes back and tells us they have no patron for margaritas.. I said ok another tequila will do she said no we need that one . So my friend orders a long island instead of the margarita she comes back we are out of long islands ... smh at this point I'm ready to go but still hungry so I stay we get r food honestly it was good well cooked. But the overall experience sucked. The manger did comp us some so it was ok but I will not b returning .

I have never seen a restaurant go downhill as fast as this one. Went in, waited 15 minutes before I stopped a hostess to go find the waitress. 20 minutes after ordering the waitress comes and says we don't have the meat for the order. So my friend ordered a burger. After 10 more minutes my food comes, but no burger. Another 10 minutes, I'm nearly done eating, the burger comes out so over-cooked it was inedible. Sent it back, 10 more minutes, out comes another over-cooked burger. So we just threw it in a carryout box for the dogs and went elsewhere to get an edible meal for my friend. They comped the burger, should have comped the whole meal. I'm done

Dinner service here was terrible! The entire staff was scrambling and scurrying around like chickens with no heads. Was greeted by a server whom we never saw again, served by the bartender after a customer complained about waiting fifteen mins for a drink, and as I was trying to leave asked to be cashed out and was refused until the bartender was finished running around. Food took so long I had forgotten what I ordered! Also my friend and I ordered breadsticks as an appetizer which she was charged for but never received. Ridiculous! Tgi's gets an F

Extremely slow service, even during empty lunch hours. Above average pricing for below average meals. Takes an extended amount of time to get food, not unreasonable to spend 90 plus minutes here. Zero people were in the restaurant and it took at least 5-10 minutes to be seated, 20 minutes before orders were placed and around 50 minutes before the food came. Another 10-20 minutes to get the bill.
Terrible service.  Food was overpriced.  Lettuce was old, wilted and brown.  Took an hour and a half to have lunch and the place was empty.

Awful Service!! I came in with intent of having dinner and beers while watching the Bengals - Steelers game.  Thirty minutes after ordering, my food is delivered without one of my sides.  After I asked about it 15 minutes later, they informed me that they were out of that side item and asked if I would like something else.  I requested a different side and continued eating my meal.   Thirty minutes later when I called the waitress over, she told me she would check on my other side.  By this time, I'd finished my meal so I told her never mind, just bring the check. I then found errors on my bill, including having charged me for the additional side.   Food was decent but the service is terrible.  I'll never visit this location again. Finished my night at the Applebees down the street

This place is a joke. The manager... Joe... is even more of a joke.  Don't plan on getting served in a decent time, don't plan on getting exactly what was order. Plan on waiting 20+ mins for drinks from the bar.  Just don't do it. Also, FYI if you want to send a complaint to corporate it is best to google the number. Otherwise, if you ask for the corporate number managers at this location are instructed to give you the number of their district manager that won't do anything.

Restaurant was almost empty had to wait 10 mins to get seated watched 2 other couples walk out.  Placed our order for a Cobb salad and fish and chips.  15 mins later waitress came out and told they where out of fish at this point we got up and left.  Would have left no stars if that was possible
